W kamiennym zamku, z dala od dzikoci wiata.\r\n\r\nPo staniu si stra偶nikiem czuje, 偶e jest coraz bli偶ej osignicia swojego celu.   "Jak zarabiala na zycie, kim byla": "Jest su偶c na dworze Gomeza, utrzymuje 偶e trafia do koloni za hazard i by podeprze swoje alibi chtnie grywa. Ponadto bystro i domorosa wiedza spowodoway 偶e dopuszczon j do poznawania arkan贸w alchemii.",
  "Znajomi, przyjaciele i wrogowie": "Przyjacielska dla wikszoci su偶cych, zwaszcza po spisku na Zevana\r\nSkrywany 偶al wobec alchemik贸w starego obozu\r\nToksyczna miostka zmieszana z nienawici do maga ognia (ale nie ogarnam 偶e to mg wic chyba meh) \r\nFascynacja alchemikiem z nowego obozu \r\nKonflikt z S贸jk\r\nBardzo dbaa o dobre relacje ze stra偶/cieniami przydzielanymi do pilnowania zamku. Jeden z nich wzi na siebie konsekwencje spisku na Zevana\r\n\r\n",
  "Slabosci": "- uzale偶nienie\r\n- mitomania\r\n- zaburzone poczucie wasnej wartoci",
  "Umiejetnosci": "-nie",
  "O postaci": "Anujka urodzia si w miecie, w rodzinie dostatecznie bogatej by zapewni dziewczynie edukacj i opiek. Kochajca, ale zajta walk o utrzymanie 偶ycia na poziomie rodzina nie zauwa偶ya, 偶e dziewczyna przejawia kopotliwe cechy. \r\nJak ka偶de dziecko niekiedy gaa, ale wkr贸tce Anujka nabraa takiej wprawy, 偶e oszuka moga ka偶dego i na ka偶dy temat.\r\nMimo tego nie ma co si (nomen omen) oszukiwa, kamstwo ma kr贸tkie nogi i niebawem jej konfabulacje zaczy wychodzi na wiato dzienne. Wywoao to szereg nieporozumie z r贸wienikami, a偶 wyposa偶ona w nowy przydomek Anujka znalaza si na marginesie 偶ycia szkolnego i towarzyskiego. \r\nKole偶anki naday jej przydomek Szarlatanka, co szybko skr贸cono do wpadajcego w ucho Tanka.\r\nIm du偶ej to trwao tym bardziej zraniona, obra偶ona i za stawaa si dziewczyna. Pozostawiona sama sobie hodowaa w sercu nienawi kt贸r kierowaa w stron wszystkich kt贸rzy wytykali j palcami. \r\nPewnego dnia, kiedy Anujka miaa jakie 11 lat jeden z nauczycieli - Lemian, postanowi wykorzysta samotno i zagubienie dziewczyny. Zwabi j do pracowni biologicznej/alchemicznej i podsun pod nos kubek sodko pachncego naparu. AI: Annually, a student attends the university as an undergraduate and studies various academic disciplines. During this time, the student learns about various fields of study and develops an understanding of how they relate to each other.

During their second year of study, the student begins to focus on research as a means of expanding their knowledge in their chosen field. They begin conducting research projects under the guidance of faculty members and participate in research-oriented activities such as attending seminars and conferences. During this time, they develop skills in critical thinking, data analysis, and communication.

During their third year, the student takes a seminar course on research methods and develops a research paper that they present to their faculty members and peers. This paper requires them to apply their knowledge of research methods to a specific field or topic. They also take courses in statistics or qualitative research methodology.

During their fourth year, the student takes a senior thesis course where they write an original research project that addresses a real-world problem or question. They work closely with a faculty member on the project and present it to the department as well as other members of their program.

The student's final year includes a capstone course in which they apply what they have learned throughout the program. This course may involve a research project, a capstone presentation, or another form of culminating activity. They are expected to show proficiency in both research and communication skills.

In their fifth year, the student completes an honors thesis that contributes to the field of study they have been studying during their undergraduate years. This project requires them to demonstrate a deep understanding of the topic as well as proficiency in research methodology. They also take courses in graduate-level statistics or specialized coursework related to their program.

Overall, the student's final year is focused on integrating knowledge and skills from various academic disciplines while preparing for the professional world. They have developed a deep understanding of their field and are well-equipped to enter a graduate school or pursue a career in research or academia.
